remarks: There exist infinitely many prime numbers: for any positive integer ` N ` , there exists a prime number ` j ` greater than ` N ` .  (See ~ infpn2 for the equinumerosity version.)  (Contributed by NM, 1-Jun-2006.)
statement:
infpn $p |- ( N e. NN -> E. j e. NN ( N < j /\ A. k e. NN ( ( j / k ) e. NN -> ( k = 1 \/ k = j ) ) ) ) $.
$d N j k $.
